metadata.title: Implement Subscription Plan Guards and Upgrade Checkout Flow

context.background: This task implements Implement Subscription Plan Guards and Upgrade Checkout Flow for Healio and is scoped as one atomic work item aligned to the PRD. It should be completed within 45 mins and leave clear evidence for follow-on tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Use Stripe-like frictionless workflows: create/edit actions should open centered modals or slide-out drawers instead of disruptive full-page forms.
Use a Viedoc-style bento layout: soft floating white cards on an off-white background for dashboards and dense data views.
Apply the Paper Replacement palette: app background near #F9FAFB, white cards, calm trustworthy accents (teal/sage/cerulean), and reserve red for critical alerts only.
Preserve high-legibility typography: clean sans-serif (Inter/SF Pro/Halyard), bold patient names, slate-gray secondary metadata.
Honor the one-click rule where applicable: keep the global + action for Add Appointment, Add Patient, and Create Invoice visible and easy to reach.
Add educational empty states with clear CTAs for first-time or empty datasets.

instruction.step: Implement the scoped changes for Implement Subscription Plan Guards and Upgrade Checkout Flow in the planned files (healio/services/subscriptionService.ts, healio/lib/feature-flags.ts, healio/app/api/v1/subscription/checkout/route.ts, healio/app/(dashboard)/settings/billing/page.tsx) while preserving the PRD-aligned project structure.
Apply validation, error handling, and consistent response/UI behavior so the task output integrates cleanly with existing helpers and patterns.
Wire integrations and dependencies for this task (endpoints: POST /api/v1/subscription/checkout) and keep tenant scoping/RBAC/security expectations intact where applicable.
Prefer in-context modal/drawer workflows, scannable bento cards, and educational empty states so the UI matches the requested Healio experience.
Verify keyboard/focus behavior, touch target sizing, and mobile responsiveness before marking the task ready.

validation_checklist.check: Exercise the related endpoint(s): POST /api/v1/subscription/checkout and verify response shape/status codes.
Run lint/typecheck or the smallest relevant test suite for the files changed by this task.
Manually verify desktop and mobile layouts plus focus/keyboard behavior for the primary interaction path.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify the implemented UI in-browser (desktop + mobile), check interactions, inspect console errors, and capture a validation snapshot before marking done.
Capture a screenshot or short note confirming empty/loading/error states are present where applicable.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Implement Subscription Plan Guards and Upgrade Checkout Flow is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (Feature 8 Subscription & Pricing) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Related endpoint behavior returns the standard success/error envelope and respects auth/public route expectations for the route class.
UI states (loading, empty, error, success) are present and visually consistent with Healio bento cards, off-white background, and trust-oriented styling.
Interactions are keyboard accessible and usable on mobile without disruptive navigation when a modal/drawer workflow is appropriate.

output_spec.commit_message: feat(healio-billing): subscription guards and upgrade flow

execution_tracking.verification_command: npm run typecheck; node --import tsx --test tests/unit/subscription-checkout-route.test.ts; Chrome DevTools MCP on /settings/billing (load + upgrade action + mobile)
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Implemented subscription plan catalog + in-memory subscription state, feature guards (`lib/feature-flags.ts` / `canAccessFeature`), protected upgrade checkout route, and a Settings Billing page that triggers Stripe-fallback checkout in-context. Chrome DevTools MCP verified the UI load, upgrade POST request, pending-plan badge, feature preview changes, mock checkout tab open, mobile layout, and clean console.

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, test commands, screenshots (UI tasks), and commit/PR references here.
Include Chrome DevTools MCP evidence (snapshot/screenshot reference and notes on responsive + interaction checks) here before marking frontend tasks complete.

Route test verification: `GET /api/v1/subscription/checkout` returns current subscription + plan catalog; `POST` creates upgrade checkout and blocks same-plan checkout (`409 PLAN_ALREADY_ACTIVE`); auth/RBAC/payload validation cases return `401/403/400` as expected.
Chrome DevTools MCP page verification on `http://localhost:4012/settings/billing`: subscription page rendered current plan, plan cards, and feature-access preview with no console errors.

Chrome DevTools MCP upgrade verification: triggered `Upgrade to Growth` (via DOM click evaluation due tool-click flake), observed `POST /api/v1/subscription/checkout` = 200 (reqid=11), mock checkout tab opened, pending plan badge (`Pending GROWTH`) displayed, provider updated to `stripe-fallback`, and feature preview switched to Growth-enabled features.
Chrome DevTools MCP responsive verification: resized to `390x844` and confirmed settings billing content/CTAs/feature list remained usable with mobile navigation visible.
Feature commit: 051fef4 (feat(healio-billing): subscription guards and upgrade flow).
